d:LiteralText.d:Text: Using this card, please tell me on how many of the last 7 days you were physically active continuously for 20 minutes or longer?

d:QuestionIntent.r:Content: The intention of this question is to measure interest in politics at the civic level

r:Description.r:Content: Contain CodeListReference to valid and missing CodeList

xhtml:div.xhtml:b: INTERVIEWER NOTE: include household tasks such as housework or Gardening if mentioned, as long as performed for 20 minutes or longer.

r:Description.r:Content: Involvement in well-being promoting activities takes a behavioural approach to measuring levels of well-being, in contrast to many of the other concepts in the module which measure subjective experiences and assessments. The concept is operationalised here through measurement of involvement in activities which fall under the Five Ways to Well-being headings. The Five Ways to Well-being are a set of positive actions which, it is hypothesised, enhance the well-being of individuals who regularly carry them out. They were developed as part of the UK governments Foresight Review of Mental Capital and Well-being and are strongly supported by the evidence base.
Be active is one element of the five ways to well-being. Be active refers to physical activity, and is broadly understood to include all actions with a physical element to them.
